question: The driver of an emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can legally:
option1: exceed the speed limit

question: When drivers see this road sign:
option1: they must not drive past this sign.
option3: they must come to a complete stop and call the police.

question: What does a yellow arrow signal mean?
option1: Vehicles moving in all directions must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
option2: The same as a green light.
option3: The same as the yellow light, but applies only to movement in the direction of the arrow.

question: If your brakes are wet, you can dry them by:
option1: riding the pedal lightly.
option2: having them checked by a mechanic.
option3: pull over to the right and wait until it stops raining.

question: This sign indicates:
option1: The road may be slippery when wet. Drive slowly.

question: This sign warns drivers of:
option1: a low place in the road.

question: A person walking with a white cane or guide dog is likely to be:
option1: a deaf person.

question: __________________ is a safe driving technique.
option1: Using your high beam lights in the fog
option3: Starring at the road ahead of your vehicle

question: Where must you position your vehicle when you prepare to make a left turn from a two-way roadway into a one-way roadway?
option1: On the right curb.
option2: As close as possible to the center line.
option3: As far to the right as possible.

question: In heavy rain, tires can begin to ride on the water that is on top of the road pavement. This is called:
option1: hydroplaning.

question: What is the meaning of red traffic signs?
option1: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.

question: If you are continually being passed on the right, you should:
option1: increase your speed immediately.
option2: move into the left lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the right.
option3: move into the right lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the left.

question: Most signs used in street work areas are:
option1: rectangle shaped.

question: Upon a second DUI conviction the violator will serve not less than ____ in jail.
option1: 45 days

question: A driver who is being passed on the right and the left by many vehicles while driving in the center lane of an highway should:
option1: move to the lane on their left.
option3: move to the lane on their right.

question: Drivers should change lanes:
option1: as quickly as possible.

question: This sign means:
option1: Open intersection ahead

question: The yield sign means:
option1: Drive with caution in wet weather.
option2: You must come to a complete stop.
option3: Slow down and give vehicles crossing your path the right-of-way.

question: This sign indicates:
option1: A slow-moving vehicle

question: Which of the following is a defensive driving skill/technique?
option1: Maintain the correct speed.
option2: Do not drive if you are very weary.

question: You want to turn left at an intersection ahead. A car reaches the intersection from the opposite direction and moves straight ahead. You:
option1: may not enter the intersection to prepare for your left turn if the light is green.
option2: must wait for the car to go through before you turn.
option3: can turn left. You have the right of way.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Divided highway ahead

question: Gauging the speed of a motorcycle may be difficult because:
option1: many motorcyclists do not activate the brake light.
option2: motorcycles take up less of your field of vision.
option3: motorcycles often slow down by downshifting.

question: Which shape is a stop sign?
option1: Upside-down triangle

question: This road sign means:
option1: There is a series of sharp turns up ahead on the road
option3: A road joins from the right

question: When approaching an intersection with a traffic control signal that is not working, drivers should:
option1: stop as you would if there were stop signs in all directions, yield the right-of-way, then enter the intersection.
option2: speed up and proceed through the intersection.
option3: try not to stop if the intersection is clear.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Limited parking

question: Which signs have black letters on a white background?
option1: Warning signs (diamond)

question: Left turns on a red light are allowed:
option1: from a one-way street into a one-way street.
option2: at intersections, after stopping, if the way is clear.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Merge

question: When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, if the road you enter has two lanes, you:
option1: must turn into its left lane.
option2: must turn into its right lane.

question: An octagonal sign means that drivers must:
option1: be aware possible hazards ahead.
option2: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

question: What does it mean If an oncoming driver flashes headlights at you during a period of low visibility?
option1: Your vehicle was difficult to see. You should turn on your headlights.
option2: Your headlights are too bright. You should use parking lights instead.
option3: Your headlights are too bright. You should turn them off.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Slow down or stop

question: Two motorcyclists are allowed to:
option1: ride side-by-side in a single lane.
option3: share the lane with another vehicle.

question: What is the ideal hand position on the steering wheel for safe driving?
option1: 7 o’clock and 5 o’clock positions.

question: Where must a pedestrian walk when there are no sidewalks?
option1: On the side of the road, in the same direction of traffic.
option2: On the side of the road, facing the traffic.
option3: In the middle of the road, facing oncoming traffic.

question: If you get on a wrong expressway exit, you must:
option1: use the the exit ramp to accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.
option2: get off at the next exit and look for signs that tell you how to return to the expressway.
option3: drive in reverse to return to the expressway.

question: If cars approaching from opposite directions reach an intersection at the same time:
option1: a car that turns right must yield to cars that move straight or turn left.
option2: a car that moves straight must yield to cars that turn left.
option3: a car that turns left must yield to cars that move straight or turn right.

question: When adjusting the driver’s seat, be sure your body is about ______ back from the steering wheel.
option1: 24 to 28 inches

question: If a driver follows you too closely, you should:
option1: activate your stop lights.
option3: move to another lane if possible.

question: If your gas pedal is stuck, you should:
option1: turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.
option2: hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it. If not, shift into neutral and use the brake to slow your vehicle and get off the road.
option3: ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.

question: When driving in fog, you should never use your high beams because:
option1: vehicles behind you may follow too closely.
option2: the light will reflect back into your eyes.
option3: oncoming vehicles might not see you.

question: This sign means:
option1: You may make a U-turn.

question: The first sign drivers see when approaching a highway-rail intersection is usually:
option1: an advance warning sign.

question: Driving while under the influence of alcohol carries:
option1: no penalty at all.
option2: a lesser penalty than for drugs.
option3: the same penalty as for drugs.

question: Yellow traffic signs:
option1: when combined with an octagonal shape, tell drivers they must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

question: These are:
option1: miles-left signs.

question: Air bags are meant to _________ seat belts.
option1: replace

question: This sign is a:
option1: guide sign.

question: When the road is slippery you should:
option1: slow and pro-ceed with caution.

question: A large vehicle is backing up to unload goods. You should:
option1: enter one of the blind spots and wait.
option2: be patient and wait until the large vehicle has completed its backup maneuver.

question: This road sign indicates that:
option1: vehicles cannot go straight ahead. Cars must turn either to the right or left.
option2: buses and car pools may not travel in the restricted lane.
option3: a lane is reserved for certain purposes or certain vehicles.

question: The Child Passenger Protection Law requires children under the age of ________ to be restrained in a child passenger restraint system.
option1: 1 year

question: To make a proper right turn:
option1: slow down and get into the lane nearest the centerline.
option2: swing to the left before turning right.
option3: give the proper signal and get into the lane nearest the right curb.

question: When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
option1: enter the two-way road to the right of its center line.
option2: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
option3: make a U-turn into the two-way road.

question: You go with a group of friends to a social event, and you plan to have a few drinks. You should:
option1: arrange to ride home with a friend who does not drink.
option2: avoid alternating between drinks with alcohol and drinks without any alcohol.
option3: make alcohol the focus of the event.

question: This sign tells drivers that:
option1: U-turns are not allowed.
option2: they must make a left turn at the intersection.
option3: they must not make a right turn.

question: How can you prevent fatigue on a long trip?
option1: Plan to drive long trips with a companion.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Wrong Way

question: Warning signs normally are:
option1: triangles.

question: Regulation signs normally are ____ rectangles with ____ letters or symbols.
option1: yellow; black

question: This sign warns drivers that:
option1: they cannot go straight ahead.
option2: they will soon be facing oncoming traffic.

question: Which statement about taking medications and driving is true?
option1: Cold medications can make a person drowsy.
option2: Prescribed drugs are safe to take at any time.
option3: Over the counter drugs do not affect driving ability.

question: The amount of alcohol in the blood is measured by:
option1: blood alcohol concentration (BAC).

question: This sign means:
option1: Take route 45 if you are driving at night.
option2: The night-time speed limit is 45 MPH.
option3: The minimum speed limit is 45 MPH.

question: When dust is blowing across the roadway making it difficult to see other vehicles, you should drive slower and turn on your:
option1: parking lights.

question: Does a vehicle prepared to enter a traffic circle or rotary have right-of-way over vehicles in the circle?
option1: No. Vehicles already in the circle have the right-of-way.
option3: Yes, but only if they are entering the rotary from the right lane.

question: Are bicyclists required to obey traffic laws and signs?
option1: Yes.
option2: No, bicyclists are considered pedestrians when it comes to the rules of the road.
option3: Yes, but only if they are riding in a bicycle lane.

question: Which shape is a speed limit sign?
option1: Round

question: Regulation signs normally are:
option1: white rectangles.

question: Interstate driving requires:
option1: a complete awareness of higher speed driving.

question: Always driving slower than other traffic:
option1: can block traffic.
option2: is always safer than driving faster than other traffic.
option3: is a good defensive driving technique.

question: When is the pavement most slippery?
option1: When it has just begun to rain.
option2: If it is been raining several hours.
option3: When it is been raining from at least one hour.

question: Signs with orange backgrounds mean:
option1: side road ahead.

question: Destination signs are ______ with ____ letters and symbols.
option1: green; white

question: This road sign means:
option1: Low clearance

question: Drivers should be aware that a motorcyclist may:
option1: decrease speed and rise off the seat when approaching a railroad crossing.
option2: quickly change speed or lane position.

question: This sign indicates that:
option1: drivers may not turn right if traveling at 25 MPH or less.
option2: the safe speed around the curve ahead is at least 25 MPH.
option3: the highest safe speed drivers should travel around the curve ahead is 25 MPH.

question: When you are angry or upset you should:
option1: take a few minutes to cool off before you drive.
option2: drive fast to let off steam.
option3: listen to loud music while driving.

question: At a stop sign there is no stop line, you must stop:
option1: before you enter the crosswalk.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Double curve ahead

question: If a traffic officer signals you to drive through a red light:
option1: you must wait for the red light to turn green.
option3: you must not obey the officer. Signs and signals take precedence over directions given by traffic officers.

question: Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
option1: they can not safely return to the right lane before they reach a solid yellow center line for the right lane.
option2: they approach the top of a hill on a two-way road and can not see over it.

question: What does a flashing red light mean?
option1: NO TURN ON RED.
option2: Drivers may move forward with caution.
option3: The same thing as a stop sign.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Multiple Turns

question: This road sign means:
option1: Stop sign ahead

question: This road sign means:
option1: Traffic signal ahead

question: If involved in a reportable accident, the operator of the vehicle must file an accident report to the Department of Safety within:
option1: 48 Hours.

question: You should signal your intentions to turn:
option1: as soon as you decide to turn.

question: Your license can be suspended if you are under 21 and drive with a BAC of:
option1: any amount.

question: After you stop for a school bus, you must:
option1: wait until the red lights stop flashing.
option2: pass the bus before the red lights stop flashing.

question: At intersections where two or more drivers stop at STOP signs at the same time and they are at right angles:
option1: the driver who is late for work has the right-of-way.
option2: the driver on the right must yield to the driver on the left.
option3: the driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right.

question: When the traffic light is green, but traffic is blocking the intersection, drivers should:
option1: enter the intersection and wait for traffic to clear.
option2: not enter the intersection until they can get completely across.
option3: honk their horn to establish their right-of-way.

question: Which of the following substances can affect the ability to drive?
option1: Tranquilizers and sedatives.
option2: Cold tablets containing codeine or antihistamines.

question: Parking is not allowed:
option1: on the road side of a parked vehicle.

question: Before changing lanes or attempting to pass another vehicle, you should:
option1: check your blind spots and, mirrors.
option2: signal your intention before changing lanes.

question: Driving under the influence (DUI) for a first conviction is determined by a blood alcohol concentration (BAC) of:
Which shape is a railroad advance warning sign?
option1: Round

question: This road sign means:
option1: Merging traffic

question: What is the main reason night driving is more difficult than daytime driving?
option1: Reduced visibility.
option2: The use of headlight is required by law.

question: This signal means:
option1: Stop

question: When approaching a construction site, drivers should:
option1: accelerate to get out of the way quickly.
option2: honk their horn to alert construction workers of their presence.
option3: slow down and adjust their driving manner.

question: This sign means:
option1: Detour to the right
option3: The road to the right is for one-way traffic only

question: More than one vehicle is approaching a four-way stop sign. Who has the right of way?
option1: The last driver to reach the intersection.
option3: The first driver to reach the intersection and stop.

question: This yellow sign means:
option1: Lane ends ahead

question: An emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can be unpredictable. Why?
option1: Emergency vehicle drivers are not required to be careful.
option2: The driver can legally pass red lights.
option3: Emergency vehicles must go faster than the posted speed limit when it is safe to do so.

question: You reach an intersection that is not controlled at the same time as a driver on your right, and both of you prepare to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
option1: You.

question: Your BAC depends on:
option1: how much time passes between drinks.

question: This road sign warns drivers that:
option1: vehicles must leave the pavement immediately.
option2: the road surface ahead changes to a low-type surface or earth road.
option3: the dirt on the side of the road is soft.

question: A solid yellow line next to a broken yellow line means that vehicles:
option1: next to the solid line may pass.
option2: next to the broken line may pass.

question: Who is most at risk?
option1: Drivers who have overslept.
option3: Drivers who are driving long distances without rest breaks.

question: If you plan to pass another vehicle, you should:
option1: not assume the other driver will make space for you to return to your lane.
option2: assume the other driver will let you pass if you use your turn signal.
option3: assume the other driver will maintain a constant speed.

question: To drive defensively you should:
option1: keep your eyes moving to look for possible hazards.
option2: always put one car length between you and the car ahead.
option3: look only at the car in front of you while driving.

question: Drivers should maintain a two-second safe following distance when driving at:
option1: any speed.

question: This sign indicates:
option1: Winding road

question: Drivers may need more space in front of their vehicle:
option1: when following motorcycles.
option2: when carrying a heavy load or pulling a trailer.

question: Which sign has white letters on a red background?
option1: Yield

question: Give the right-of-way to any pedestrian:
option1: on the opposite side of the street.
option3: if you have the green light.

question: _______ signs provide regulations or important information.
option1: Diamond

question: This sign means:
option1: 270 degree turn ahead.

question: Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit on primary and secondary state and federal highways is:
option1: 65 MPH

question: When following motorcycles, drivers should:
option1: keep more space in front of their vehicle.
option3: try to pass them as they have different braking capabilities than other motor vehicles.

question: If you meet a stopped school bus with the lights flashing and the signal arm extended, you should:
option1: watch for children and proceed at normal speed.
option2: proceed at 15 MPH or less, if no children are present.

question: When driving at night with no other vehicles ahead, a driver should use:
option1: low-beam lights.

question: Continuous hard braking on ice and snow often:
option1: causes the front wheels to lock.
option3: is the best option during winter.

question: On average, how long does it take your body to remove the alcohol contained in 5 ounces of wine?
option1: 3 hours.

question: Who has a greater risk of being involved in a traffic crash?
option1: Drivers who are driving alone.

question: In the following situations, drivers should increase their following interval:
option1: When it is hard to see ahead because of bad weather.
option2: When following vehicles that are required to come to a stop at railroad crossings.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Do not pass
option2: Divided highway ahead - stay to the right

question: If you have had three beers in the past hour, about how long will it take for all the alcohol to leave your blood stream?
option1: Two hours.

question: Service signs are ____ with ____ letters and symbols.
option1: white; black

question: You should never depend on your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes. Why?
option1: Mirrors are useless.
option2: Mirrors leave “blind spots” behind both sides of vehicles.

question: Which of the following drugs could affect your ability to drive?
option1: Marijuana.

question: A defensive driver:
option1: knows when it is safe to pass other vehicles.
option2: considers what other drivers might do and is always prepared to act.
option3: never drives below the speed limit.

question: Vertical rectangles tell drivers:
option1: the direction they should travel.

question: This road sign means the road you are driving on:
option1: turns sharply to the left and then right
option3: turns to the right and then the left

question: This sign means:
option1: Parking is not allowed at 8:30 AM and at 5:30 PM
option2: You can only park between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
option3: No parking between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.

question: On what three conditions does your blood alcohol content (BAC) depend?
option1: Your height. How much alcohol you drink. The type of beverage you drink.
option2: Your weight. How much alcohol you drink. How much time passes between drinks.
option3: Your weight. The type of beverage you drink. How fit you are.

question: What is the first thing to do when you make a three-point turn?
option1: Signal with your right turn signal, then pull over to the right and stop.
option2: Signal with your left turn signal, then check carefully for traffic coming toward you.
option3: Turn left, go across the road so you come to a stop while you face the edge of the road.

question: A solid yellow line on your side of the center line means:
option1: Pass with caution

question: What does this road sign indicate?
option1: Drivers have the right of way over bikes turning left.
option2: Vehicles turning left must yield to bikes entering a right turn lane.
option3: Motor vehicles entering an exclusive right-turn lane must weave across bicycle traffic in bicycle lanes.

question: Drivers should use the turn signal ________ before making a turn.
option1: 25 feet

question: If a vehicle is coming towards you at night with its high beams on, making it hard to see the road ahead, you should:
option1: look straight ahead towards the middle of the lane.
option2: look ahead towards the right edge of your lane.
option3: look ahead towards the left edge of your lane.

question: This road sign means:
option1: You have the right of way

question: The octagonal shape is used:
option1: to warn drivers of existing or possible hazards on roadways.
option3: for stop signs and railroad advance warning signs.

question: Alcohol is:
option1: a stimulant.

question: Two drivers reach an uncontrolled intersection at the same time. Who has the right of way?
option1: The driver on the right.

question: This sign means:
option1: The road ends ahead

question: The traffic light is green and you want to drive straight through an intersection. If a car is already in the intersection and is making a turn, you must:
option1: drive through the intersection. You have the right-of-way.
option2: enter the intersection and then stop.
option3: let that car complete its turn before you enter the intersection.

question: This sign means:
option1: Narrow bridge ahead. Slow down and drive with caution.
option2: Do not to enter if your vehicle is taller than the height listed on the sign.

question: What is the meaning of orange traffic signs?
option1: Warning of school, pedestrian, and bicycling activity.

question: This road sign means:
option1: School zone

question: __________________ are not required to stop before crossing any railroad grade crossing.
option1: School or church buses

question: What do warning signs mean?
option1: Drivers are approaching a location where there is a special rule.

question: If traffic on the other side of an intersection is backed up and you cannot get completely through, you must:
option1: enter the intersection and try to avoid blocking it.
option2: wait until traffic ahead is clear.
option3: enter the intersection and proceed with caution.

question: If you are involved in a crash and must move an injured person, you should:
option1: go to prison.
option2: pull the victim feet first away from the danger.
option3: keep the back and neck as straight as possible.

question: What should drivers do when they see this sign?
option1: Make sure the bridge is clear of oncoming traffic before they cross.
option3: Look to the left and right for other traffic.

question: Emergency crossovers on the interstate are legal in Tennessee for:
option1: making a U-Turn when you missed your exit.
option2: turning around when no other vehicles are present.
option3: emergency vehicles and highway maintenance crews only.

question: If an intersection has crosswalk lines but no STOP line, where must you stop for a red light?
option1: After the crosswalk.

question: If you have had a few beers, the effects of alcohol will be reduced only by:
option1: taking a cold shower.

question: The sign in the picture:
option1: shows the highest speed drivers can travel at the exit of the intersection.
option2: is used to advise motorists of the appropriate ramp speed at the highway exit point.
option3: indicates the minimum ramp speed at the highway exit point.

question: This sign means:
option1: The divided highway ends ahead.
option2: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

question: The yield sign means:
option1: Stop if you can.
option2: If the way is clear, you may move forward slowly without stopping.
option3: Go. The light will soon be red.

question: When turning left from a two-way street onto a one-way street, drivers should:
option1: turn into any lane.

question: Driver distractions include:
option1: Avoiding unnecessary lane changes.
option2: Slowing down to look at crash scene.
option3: turning your headlights on when rain and fog make it hard to see.

question: Parking is not allowed:
option1: on public roads
option2: in an intersection, unless permitted by signs.
option3: within 300 feet of a pedestrian safety area.

question: Where there is no bicycle lane, where on the road must a bicyclist ride?
option1: near the left edge of the road.
option2: on the left shoulder of the road.
option3: near the right curb or edge of the road.

question: You face a green light, but traffic on the other side of the intersection does not allow you to travel all the way through the intersection. What must you do?
option1: Wait for the next green light.
option2: Wait until traffic ahead clears, so you do not block the intersection.
option3: Enter the intersection and wait until traffic ahead clears.

question: This sign tells drivers that:
option1: a divided highway ends ahead.
option2: there is a right turn ahead.
option3: they must stay on the right side of the divider

question: Drivers should check their rearview mirrors:
option1: often to see how traffic is moving behind them.
option3: to see if a truck is in their blind spot.

question: The road is the most slippery:
option1: after it rains.
option2: when it first starts to rain.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Watch for trucks entering from the side

question: What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
option1: To keep a smooth traffic flow.
option3: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.

question: Following another vehicle too closely is known as:
option1: tailgating.

question: The sign in the picture:
option1: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.
option2: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.
option3: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.

question: A steady yellow light means:
option1: Be prepared to stop for the red light.
option2: Be prepared to go. The light will soon be green.

question: This warning sign:
option1: provides advance notice to upcoming speed limit change.
option2: shows the current speed limit that all vehicles traveling in the direction of the arrow must not exceed.
option3: indicates the suggested highest safe speed.

question: What should drivers do in case of a brake failure?
option1: Shift to a lower gear.
option2: Tie a white cloth on the left door handle.

question: This is the shape and color of a ________ sign.
option1: yield

question: If you see orange construction signs and cones on a freeway, you must:
option1: make a U-turn because the lane ends ahead.
option2: be prepared for workers and equipment ahead.
option3: maintain your current speed while changing lanes.

question: The penalty for a first DUI conviction twill be:
option1: a fine, 48 hours in jail and 1 year revocation.
option3: a $100 fine, 24 hours in jail and 6 months revocation.

question: If you are not the first at the scene of accident and your help is not needed, you should:
option1: stop and give help.
option2: slow down and ask if any help is needed.
option3: drive on and do not interfere with procedures.

question: What is the most important rule to remember in any emergency?
option1: Call the police.

question: When a hazard is seen ahead, reaction distance:
option1: equals total stopping distance minus perception distance.
option2: is how far a vehicle will continue to travel, in ideal conditions, before the driver hits the brakes.
option3: is the sum of perception distance and braking distance.

question: Which of the following is true about the Anti-Locking Brake System?
option1: It allows drivers to steer during an emergency braking situation.

question: Always stop before you cross railroad tracks when:
option1: you are following a bicyclist or motorcyclist across railroad tracks.
option2: you do not have room on the other side to completely cross the tracks.
option3: you are not wearing safety belts.

question: This road sign means:
option1: School crossing

question: _________________ your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes.
option1: Always rely on

question: This road sign means:
option1: Stop and yield to pedestrians and cross traffic
option2: Be prepared to stop if necessary
option3: Slow down and be prepared to stop

question: What should you do in case of a brake failure?
option1: Pull off the road into an open space, if available.

question: This sign means:
option1: The driver is near a school and should watch for children.
option2: There is a work zone ahead. Watch for workers.
option3: Business area nearby. Watch for business people.

question: This road sign means:
option1: No U-turn
option3: Do not pass on the left.

question: This road sign means:
option1: A steep grade is ahead

question: Before crossing any railroad tracks, you must:
option1: make sure there is room for your vehicle on the other side.

question: If there is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane, you should:
option1: stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing.
option2: make sure the pedestrian can see you before proceeding.
option3: honk your horn and proceed with caution.

question: Slowing down just to look at collisions or anything else out of ordinary:
option1: helps prevent rear-end collisions.

question: The ‘Slower Traffic Keep Right’ sign is used:
option1: at most intersections.

question: Which statement about drinking alcohol and driving is true?
option1: Alcohol affects judgement and coordination, which are needed to drive safely.
option2: After drinking, a cold shower will sober you up.
option3: If you are under the legal BAC limit, your driving is not affected.

question: BAC is:
option1: the percentage of alcohol in your blood.
option2: the number of ounces of alcohol in your blood.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Railroad Warning

question: This road sign means:
option1: No left turn

question: If you are blinded by headlights on an approaching vehicle, you should:
option1: move your eyes to the right.
option2: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.

question: A broken white line:
option1: marks the right edge of the roadway.
option2: separates two lanes traveling in the same direction.
option3: means passing or crossing is prohibited in that lane.

question: A 4-way stop sign means:
option1: The first vehicle to reach the intersection should move forward first.
option2: There are four stop signs at the intersection.

question: When they see a yellow X signal, drivers should:
option1: turn off the ignition.
option2: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.
option3: prepare to leave the lane safely.

question: This road sign means:
option1: No right turn

question: This road sign means:
option1: No left turn

question: This sign tells drivers:
option1: they must wait for the traffic signal to turn green before turning right or left.
option2: they may not turn right or left during the red light.

question: The shape of a route sign tells you:
option1: that the route you are on might be dangerous.
option2: the speed limit on that route.
option3: the type of route you are on.

question: If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to expressway speed, you should:
option1: enter the expressway and accelerate quickly.
option2: reduce your speed to 15 MPH or less and blend with traffic.
option3: stop and wait for a large space in traffic.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Two-way traffic ahead

question: This road sign means:
option1: Slippery when wet
option2: Do not use your brakes in this area

question: Unlike passenger cars, trucks have blind spots:
option1: on the right.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Yield sign ahead
option3: Side road entering from the left

question: This sign tells drivers that:
option1: left and right turns are not allowed.

question: When they see this sign, drivers:
option1: should not speed up or brake quickly.
option2: should be prepared to make sharp turns at a high speed.
option3: need to be prepared to turn right and then left quickly.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Keep right

question: This sign means:
option1: Sharp right turn ahead.

question: What is the slow moving vehicle symbol?
option1: A reflective yellow diamond

question: A red traffic sign means?
option1: Railroad crossing.

question: What can you do to prevent skids on snow and ice?
option1: Brake early and gently.
option2: Allow the wheels to keep turning.

question: What is a likely effect when you take another drug while you drink alcohol?
option1: The effects of the alcohol and the drug are enhanced.
option2: If the drug is over-the-counter, there are no effects.
option3: There are no effects, unless the drug is prescription only.

question: At intersections marked with stop lines, drivers must:
option1: slow down and enter the intersection.

question: This road sign means:
option1: No left turn

question: What should you do if your headlights suddenly go out?
option1: Brake immediately and activate your emergency lights.
option2: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
option3: Use your emergency lights, parking lights or directional signals.

question: There are two traffic lanes in your direction. You are driving in the left lane and many vehicles are passing you on the right, and the driver behind you wishes to drive faster. You should:
option1: drive onto the left shoulder to let the other driver pass.
option2: move over into the right lane when safe to do so.
option3: stay in your lane and maintain your current speed.

question: There is no crosswalk and a pedestrian is crossing your lane ahead. You should:
option1: stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing the street.
option2: slow down as you pass the pedestrian.
option3: make eye contact and then pass the pedestrian.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Turn left or go through

question: Traffic lights are normally ____________ from the top to bottom or left to right.
option1: red, green and yellow

question: You ________ traffic headed toward you when you turn left.
option1: must yield to

question: A driver cuts off another vehicle, or threatens another motorist or a pedestrian. These are examples of:
option1: road rage

question: When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.
option1: stop much more slowly

question: When the road is slippery, you should:
option1: pump your brakes.
option3: press your brakes in slow, steady strokes.

question: Arrows on the roadway:
option1: indicate HOV lanes.
option3: show which lanes you must use.

question: Blind spots around a large vehicle are _________________ than the blind spots around a car.
option1: less dangerous

question: A red traffic sign means?
option1: Do not enter.

question: When driving on an interstate, you should NOT:
option1: change lanes without signaling.
option2: going to the next exit if you miss your exit.
option3: keep to the right if you are driving slower than other vehicles.

question: What should drivers do when the red lights begin to flash?
option1: Slow down.

question: When changing lanes:
option1: change lane before checking the inside rearview mirror.
option2: look over your shoulder to make sure no one is in the blind spot.
option3: slow down and check your left mirror.

question: When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, you must:
option1: move into the right lane, or to the right side of a single lane.
option2: move into the right lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
option3: move into the left lane, or to the left side of a single lane.

question: This regulatory sign tells drivers that:
option1: traffic in the left lane must turn left at the intersection ahead.
option2: traffic in the right lane must go straight.
option3: all vehicles must turn left immediately.

question: Which of the following is NOT true about ABS?
option1: It helps increase your stopping distance.

question: When you approach this sign, you must:
option1: watch for workers crossing the road.

question: This sign indicates:
option1: Phone service ahead

question: After parking, are you allowed to open a door on the road side of your vehicle?
option1: Yes, but only if it does not interfere with bicyclists and other traffic.

question: To maintain an adequate "space cushion" to the front, drivers need to:
option1: control their speed to suit the road and traffic conditions.
option2: keep a safe distance between their car and the vehicle in front.
option3: The other answers are both correct.

question: When you make a left turn from a two-way road into a four-lane highway, you must:
option1: enter the left lane, to the right of the center line.
option2: go straight through the intersection, and then make the turn.
option3: enter the right lane, to the left of the center line.

question: This sign warns of a ________ ahead.
option1: soft shoulder

question: This sign means:
option1: road construction.

question: What should you do if your brakes fail?
option1: Hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it.
option3: Try pumping the brake pedal to increase pressure.

question: If an approaching driver does not dim the headlights, you should:
option1: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.
option2: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
option3: flash your headlights to low beam for a second, then return to high beam.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Persons with Disabilities Parking

question: When approaching any intersection or driveway, drivers should:
option1: pass other vehicles and then stop.
option2: look both ways and be ready to stop.
option3: drive at the fastest speed just before entering the intersection.

question: This sign means:
option1: The center lane is shared for left turns.
option3: Left turns in both directions of travel are not permitted.

question: Directions given by traffic officers ___________ signs, signals or pavement markings.
option1: must obey

question: When entering an interstate highway, drivers should:
option1: wait for an opening in traffic on the entrance ramp.
option2: adjust speed to meet a traffic gap, then merge at a safe speed.
option3: check for cars and slow down to 25 MPH before merging with the flow of traffic.

question: Blind spots are:
option1: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.
option2: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.
option3: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.

question: You are stopped at a stop sign and you are going to go straight through the intersection. A car on the cross road has stopped at a stop sign on your right and is going to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
option1: You.

question: It is 10 AM. This sign tells you that:
option1: you must display a special permit in order to park here.
option2: you are allowed to park until 5:30 PM.
option3: you are not allowed to park here.

question: Collisions can happen more often when:
option1: one lane of traffic is traveling faster than the others.
option2: one vehicle is traveling faster than the flow of traffic.
option3: all vehicles are traveling at the posted speed limit.

question: This road sign warns drivers that:
option1: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.
option2: left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
option3: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.

question: You are entering a roadway from a private road, and you need to turn left. You have to yield to:
option1: vehicles from the right.

question: This is:
option1: a right curve sign.

question: What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
option1: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
option2: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Keep left

question: Driving under the influence of any medication which impairs your driving ability is permitted:
option1: if it is prescribed by a physician.

question: When you come to an intersection which has a flashing red light, you must:
option1: come to a full stop, then proceed when safe to do so.
option2: stop only if other vehicles are already in the intersection.
option3: slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary.

question: When drivers see the ‘Wrong Way’ sign:
option1: they must drive past this sign and reach the next intersection.
option2: they must not leave the pavement except in an emergency.
option3: they are going the wrong way on an expressway exit ramp.

question: What should you do when an aggressive driver confronts you?
option1: Avoid eye contact with the aggressive driver.
option3: Challenge the aggressive driver with increased speed.

question: Speed limit signs are:
option1: warning signs

question: This road sign means:
option1: No trucks allowed

question: When you see this sign you should:
option1: slow your speed and do not pass other vehicles.
option2: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.
option3: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.

question: A driver license may be suspended or revoked for:
option1: fraudulently altering a driver license.
option2: allowing another individual to use your license or identification.

question: You are driving and you are feeling drowsy. You should:
option1: avoid drinking coffee.
option2: turn on the radio to keep you awake.
option3: find a safe place to stop for a break.

question: Diamond-shaped signs:
option1: typically provide guidance to drivers.
option3: are used to warn of hazards on roadways.

question: When passing a motorcycle you must:
option1: give the motorcyclist the right hand part of his traffic lane.
option2: give the motorcyclist the entire traffic lane as if the motorcycle was a car.
option3: sound your horn to alert the motorcyclist.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Slow-moving vehicle

question: If the rear of your vehicle is skidding to the right, you should:
option1: steer to the left.
option3: hold the steering wheel tightly and shift into neutral to bring the front of the vehicle back in line.

question: What type of pavement marking shows you which lane you must use for a turn?
option1: Edge line

question: When a pedestrian carrying a white cane is at the corner ready to cross the street in front of you, before making your right turn, you should:
option1: turn off the ignition until the person crosses the street.
option2: yield the right-of-way and wait until the pedestrian crosses the street.
option3: use your horn to help the pedestrian cross the street.

question: ___________ normally are white rectangles with black letters or symbols.
option1: Destination signs (guide signs)

question: When they approach this sign, drivers must:
option1: obey signals from crossing guards.
option2: slow down and watch for children crossing the road.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Intersection ahead

question: When they see this sign, drivers should:
option1: be ready to shift to lower gear.
option2: be ready to brake sharply and stop.
option3: yield to trucks coming from the hill on the right.

question: Which signs have black letters on a yellow or orange background?
option1: Regulatory signs (vertical rectangle)

question: As you drive on the expressway, make sure:
option1: your directional signal goes off before you change lanes.
option3: you cut off vehicles behind you when you change lanes.

question: Roads are the most slippery:
option1: the first rain after a dry spell.
option2: after it has been raining for an hour or more.
option3: for the first 2 hours of a rain storm.

question: You can reduce the chance of a collision with a large vehicle if you:
option1: delay near it.
option2: cut abruptly in front of it.
option3: pay close attention to the turn signals.

question: __________ are blue with white letters and symbols.
option1: Destination signs (guide signs)

question: This road sign warns drivers that:
option1: the one-way street or roadway is about to change to two-way traffic.
option2: they are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

question: This road sign means:
option1: School crossing

question: You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:
option1: if it’s raining.

question: A red arrow on a traffic light means:
option1: You must stop and then proceed when the way is clear.
option2: You may turn in in the direction of the arrow after coming to a complete stop.
option3: You may not turn in the direction of the arrow until a green light or arrow light goes on.

question: What should you do if a vehicle is approaching head-on in your lane?
option1: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other driver.
option2: Pull over to the left and use your emergency lights to stop the other driver.
option3: Turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.

question: When drivers come to this sign, they must:
option1: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.
option2: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.
option3: be ready to stop at the stop sign.

question: This sign warns ____________ ahead.
option1: that a divided highway ends

question: ___________ are green with white letters and symbols.
option1: Warning signs

question: What is the only effective method to reduce your BAC?
option1: Not drinking over a period of time.
option2: Eating before or while you drink.

question: When driving on the freeway behind large trucks, you should:
option1: move to the right of the truck and pass it quickly.
option2: drive closer behind the truck than for a passenger vehicle.

question: The yield sign is ___ and white, with ___ letters.
option1: red; white

question: This road sign means:
option1: Do not enter

question: You can pass on the right:
option1: when a vehicle ahead makes a left turn.
option2: when a vehicle ahead makes a right turn.
option3: when a vehicle that is approaching from the opposite direction is prepared to turn left.

question: What should you do if your vision through the windshield becomes blocked?
option1: Open the side window so you can see.

question: This sign means:
option1: No parking on pavement.

question: For proper parking, if stopping at a curb you should move to within _______ of the curb.
option1: 12 inches

question: When children are close, what should you do before you back out of a driveway?
option1: Get out of the car and check behind the car.
option2: Look through your back window for children.

question: Examples of proper glass maintenance include:
option1: Keeping your windows clean and clear.

question: This sign warns drivers that:
option1: right turns are not allowed.
option2: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.
option3: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.

question: When riding in a vehicle equipped with air bags is, children ages 12 and under are safer:
option1: in the bed of a pick-up truck.
option2: buckled up in the front seat.
option3: buckled up in the back seat.

question: You hear a siren close by but can not see where the emergency vehicle is. What do you do?
option1: Stop immediately and activate your emergency flashers.
option2: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure the emergency vehicle is not headed toward you.
option3: Keep driving until you are sure the emergency vehicle is headed toward you.

question: It is illegal to park:
option1: on public roadways.
option2: within 50 feet of a railroad crossing.
option3: within 15 feet of a fire hydrant.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Slippery when wet

question: A broken yellow line to the right of a solid yellow center line means:
option1: you are only allowed to make left turns in this area.
option3: you may pass other vehicles if no oncoming traffic is present.

question: Before making a left turn from a one-way street, you must:
option1: be in the lane closest to the right curb.
option2: be in the lane closest to the left curb.
option3: be in the lane closest to the center of the street.

question: Never make a U-turn from:
option1: the left part of the lane nearest to the centerline of the roadway.

question: A vehicle that enters a road from a driveway:
option1: must stop and yield the right-of-way to traffic on the roadway and to pedestrians.
option3: must yield to traffic approaching from the right, while it has the right-of-way over vehicles approaching from the left.

question: Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
option1: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.
option2: their lane has a solid yellow center line.

question: To drive defensively, you must:
option1: keep one hand on the steering wheel.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Divided highway ends

question: This sign warns drivers of:
option1: a cross road.

question: A pedestrian in the crosswalk when the "DON’T WALK" signal begins flashing must:
option1: finish crossing the street.
option2: go back and wait the “WALK” light

question: At an intersection with traffic signals, if you are not in the proper lane to make a right or left turn you should:
option1: continue to the next intersection to make the desired turn.
option2: stop and wait until the way is clear before turning.
option3: signal the direction you want to go and wait for a gap.

question: Regulatory signs are:
option1: Law

question: An advisory letter is mailed to a licensee having ____ points on a driving record within twelve months.
To see vehicles in your blind spots, you must look:
option1: in your side mirrors.

question: What does the flashing signal in the picture indicate?
option1: The same thing as a stop sign.
option2: Pedestrians should start crossing the street.
option3: Pedestrians should finish crossing the street if started.

question: Which statement about blind spots is true?
option1: Large trucks have smaller blind spots than most passenger vehicles.
option2: Before changing lanes, you should check mirrors and look over your shoulder toward the rear.
option3: If traffic conditions permit you should cruise in blind spot of the vehicle ahead.

question: If you continually pass the other vehicles on a road with one lane in each direction, you will:
option1: help prevent the chances of a crash occurring due to traffic congestion.
option2: get to your destination much faster.
option3: increase your chances of being involved in an accident.

question: In 55 MPH traffic you are least likely to be involved in a collision if you:
option1: drive a few MPH slower than most.
option3: drive a few MPH faster than most.

question: Pentagonal signs are used to indicate:
option1: possible hazards on roadways.

question: To avoid glare from headlights of an approaching car:
option1: do not look directly into the oncoming headlights, look toward the right edge of your lane.
option2: stay focused on the center line on the road.

question: Implied Consent Law means that:
option1: road signs, markings and signals present are implicitly valid even if not present.
option2: if asked by an officer, you will take a test to determine alcohol or drug content in your blood.
option3: you may refuse to field sobriety tests.

question: If your car becomes disabled on a highway, you should:
option1: stop in the right lane.
option2: park with all four wheels off the highway, if possible.

question: To reduce their chances of colliding with an animal, drivers should:
option1: scan the sides of the road to watch for the reflection of vehicle headlights in the eyes of animals.
option2: look well down the road and far off to each side.

question: Road signs that point out scenic areas and parks are:
option1: green and white.

question: A flashing yellow light means:
option1: The light will soon change from green to red.
option2: Yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.

question: If you remain in the back blind spot of a large vehicle:
option1: you can reduce fuel consumption.
option2: you increase the chance of a crash.
option3: the large vehicle will take much longer to stop.

question: Green and white signs:
option1: warn drivers of unexpected road conditions.
option2: give information about directions and distances.
option3: are mainly used at intersections and driveways.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Road curves ahead

question: When parking on a public road, drivers should:
option1: move as far away from traffic as possible.
option2: always park on the left side of the roadway.

question: Driving at night is more dangerous because:
option1: your reaction time is slower.
option2: you cannot see as far ahead at night.

question: The only effective way to reduce your blood alcohol content (BAC) is:
option1: drinking coffee.
option2: not to drink over a period of time.

question: This sign means:
option1: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
option2: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.

question: A curb painted red means:
option1: No parking or stopping
option2: Reserved for passengers pick up or drop off
option3: Parking is for disabled persons with a special placard or plate.

question: What should you do in case of a steering failure?
option1: Do not panic. Turn on your emergency lights to let other drivers know you are having car problems. Move toward the side of the road and bring the car to a gradual stop.
option3: Pump your gas pedal a few times to increase the pressure.

question: Slow moving vehicles shall turn or pull off the roadway when there are ________ vehicles in line behind them?
option1: five or more

question: What does this sign indicate?
option1: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
option2: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.
option3: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.

question: What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
option1: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
option2: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.
option3: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.

question: When in a motor vehicle on a highway, it is:
option1: permissible to drink a moderate amount of alcohol when driving with a passenger.
option2: acceptable to drink alcoholic beverages if you are not driving.
option3: illegal to possess an open container of alcohol in the passenger compartment.

question: A thumping sound can be a warning:
option1: that a tire blowout is about to occur.

question: Double solid lines on the roadway mean:
option1: you can not go across the lines except to turn left to enter or leave the highway.

question: This road sign means:
option1: You must bear either right or left
option3: A road joins from the left

question: How many different classes of mopeds are there?
This road sign means:
option1: Left turns are permitted
option3: You may turn right after yielding the right-of-way to oncoming traffic

question: This sign warns drivers of:
option1: a dip in the road. Drivers should be ready to stop if the dip is filled with water.
option2: a bridge ahead, wide enough to accommodate two lanes of traffic, but with very little clearance.

question: As the percentage of alcohol in your blood (BAC) increases, you become:
option1: more sober.

question: To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
option1: Adjust your schedule to drive during times with the most highway traffic.
option2: Allow enough travel time to reach your destination on schedule.

question: Before a school bus stops to load passengers, the driver will usually flash:
option1: red lights.

question: If you hear a thumping sound while driving, you should:
option1: get off the road and check your tires.
option2: hook your shoe under the gas pedal and see if you can free it.

question: When you see this sign you should stop and:
option1: check traffic in all direction before proceeding.
option2: yield the right-of way to all vehicles coming from the left.
option3: check for vehicles in the opposite direction, then proceed.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Merging traffic

question: This road sign means:
option1: Warning, crossroad ahead

question: A four-way stop sign means:
option1: if two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
option2: traffic from all four directions must stop.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Lane reduction - the left lane ends soon
option3: Lane reduction - the right lane ends soon

question: On two-lane, two-way streets or highways, you should start left turns:
option1: close to the center line.

question: While inside the roundabout, you should:
option1: use your left turn signal if you are in position to exit now.
option2: change lanes before you check for vehicles behind you.
option3: remain in your lane until you are ready to exit.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Road curves ahead

question: A flashing yellow light:
option1: warns drivers to proceed with caution.

question: This sign warns drivers that:
option1: the road ahead is narrow.
option2: there is a one lane bridge ahead.

question: Large trucks:
option1: take longer to stop than passenger vehicles.
option2: are more maneuverable than passenger vehicles.
option3: have high-tech air brakes which allow them to stop quickly.

question: ABS is the acronym for:
option1: Anti-Locking Brake System

question: This road sign:
option1: warns drivers of a sharp turn left. Drivers should slow their speed and keep to the left.
option2: warns drivers that U-turns are not permitted.
option3: provides an advance notice of a roundabout.

question: This road sign means:
option1: No stopping

question: Roads are most slippery:
option1: just before it rains.
option2: when it first starts to rain.

question: A traffic signal with a yellow left means:
option1: HOV lane is about to end.
option2: Prepare to yield to oncoming traffic.

question: You must come to a full stop at a yield sign:
option1: Always.

question: What does this road sign indicate?
option1: Area reserved for people with disabilities

question: This sign warns that:
option1: traffic must merge left.
option3: the bridge ahead is wide enough for only one vehicle at a time.

question: Drivers may cross a double yellow line to pass another vehicle if:
option1: the yellow line next to the other side of the road is broken.
option2: the vehicle ahead moves to the right to let them pass.
option3: the yellow line next to their side of the road is broken.

question: When coming to an intersection with a yield sign, you should:
option1: yield the right-of-way to all traffic on the left.
option2: always come to a complete stop before entering the intersection.
option3: slow down and yield the right-of-way to other vehicles.

question: What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
option1: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.
option3: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.

question: Braking distance is:
option1: how far a vehicle will continue to travel before the driver hits the brakes.
option2: the total distance a vehicle has traveled until it comes to a complete stop.
option3: how far a vehicle will travel, in ideal conditions, while the driver is braking.

question: When changing lanes, you should remember that:
option1: vehicles with two outside mirrors have no blind spots.
option2: you should look over your left shoulder for a left lane change and your right shoulder for a right lane change.
option3: You only need to turn and look over your right shoulder for lane changes to the right or left.

question: What do pennant-shaped signs indicate?
option1: A school crossing

question: Alcohol:
option1: makes drivers more prone to take chances.

question: After passing a vehicle, it is safe to return to your lane when:
option1: the driver you passed slows down to let you return to your lane.
option2: you can see both headlights of the vehicle you just passed in your rearview mirror.
option3: you are at least 100 feet ahead of the vehicle you passed.

question: This sign indicates the _______________ vehicles can safely travel in this area.
option1: minimum speed

question: When preparing to exit an expressway, drivers should start reducing their speed:
option1: about halfway through the deceleration lane.
option2: at least 100 feet before entering the deceleration lane.
option3: immediately upon entering the deceleration lane.

question: Tennessee law requires you to notify the Department of Safety of your address change within:
option1: 10 days.

question: This sign indicates:
option1: a church zone ahead.

question: For protection, motorcyclists are required to:
option1: wear approved helmets.
option2: signal turns, lane changes and stops.
option3: keep their headlights and taillights on at all times.

question: This regulatory road sign indicates that:
option1: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.
option2: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.
option3: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Trucks have the right-of-way

question: This sign warns drivers that:
option1: they must turn either to the right or left.
option2: there is a double curve ahead.
option3: there is a winding road ahead.

question: What should you do if you see smoke come from under the hood?
option1: Pull off the road and park your vehicle. Turn off the ignition, get away from the car and call the fire department.
option2: Call the fire department and then pull off the road and park your vehicle.
option3: Try to fight the fire yourself.

question: What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
option1: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
option2: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.

question: When you pass another vehicle, before you return to the right lane, you must:
option1: signal.
option2: look at your interior rear-view mirror.

question: What is the meaning of blue traffic signs?
option1: Blue indicates road user services.
option2: A blue background indicates a regulatory sign.

question: BAC is expressed in:
option1: percentage of blood to alcohol.
option3: ounces of alcohol in your blood.

question: Which shape is a warning sign?
option1: Pennant

question: When they see this road sign, drivers should:
option1: drive carefully because the animal pictured on the sign is extremely rare in the area.
option2: watch for this species crossing the road.

question: Who is most at risk?
option1: Drivers who are fatigued.
option2: Drivers who are driving on long, boring roads.

question: Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
option1: signal the train to stop.
option2: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.

question: Alcohol:
option1: makes it easier to make correct decisions.
option2: makes you less aware of what is happening to your driving abilities.

question: What does a flashing left yellow arrow mean?
option1: Left turns are allowed. Yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
option3: Vehicles turning left must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.

question: When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
option1: approach the turn in the right lane or from the right side of a single lane.
option2: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
option3: approach the turn in the left lane or from the left side of a single lane.

question: When you see this sign, you should:
option1: slow down, proceed with caution and watch for blind people.
option3: be prepared to stop if children are in the crosswalk.

question: What does the pictured signal indicate?
option1: A pedestrian may begin crossing the street.
option2: A pedestrian may not not begin crossing the street.

question: With a BAC of .10%, you are _______ times more likely to cause an accident than if you were sober.
This sign means:
option1: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.
option2: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
option3: A road crosses the main highway ahead.

question: This sign means:
option1: Bicycles should yield to vehicles ahead.
option2: Warning: a bikeway crosses the roadway ahead.
option3: The lane ahead is reserved for bicycles.

question: It is illegal to turn around near a curve when the driver cannot:
option1: drive on the shoulder of the road.
option2: see at least 500 feet in each direction.

question: If a pedestrian is in the middle of the street when your signal light changes to green, you should:
option1: proceed unless the pedestrian is in your lane.
option2: wait until the pedestrian crosses the street before proceeding.
option3: proceed because you have the right-of-way.

question: Drivers may legally block an intersection:
option1: under no circumstances.
option3: only after entering the intersection on a green light.

question: What should you do as you prepare to turn right at an intersection?
option1: Yield to bicyclists coming from the opposite direction.
option2: Signal your turn, check for bicyclists, and do not turn directly in front of a bicyclist.

question: An edge line that angles toward the center of the road indicates that:
option1: you must turn right.

question: When taking medication while driving, you should:
option1: consult your physicians and/or pharmacist regarding any prescription medication and its possible effects on driving.
option3: drive 20 MPH below the posted speed limit.

question: Your red traffic signal changes to green while a pedestrian is crossing in your traffic lane. The right of way should be given:
option1: by the pedestrian, but only when vehicles are turning left.

question: This sign is a warning that you are approaching:
option1: a railroad crossing.

question: Do not be afraid to sound a sharp blast on your horn when:
option1: when a child is about to run into the street.
option2: another vehicle is in danger of hitting you.

question: If you see a “lane closed ahead” sign you should:
option1: make a U-turn. You are on the wrong side of the road.
option2: speed to the end of the closed lane and try to get into the other lane.
option3: merge into the correct lane when it is safe.

question: What do flashing red lights on a school bus indicate?
option1: The bus is about to stop.
option2: Traffic that approaches from either direction may proceed.
option3: The bus is stopped to load or discharge passengers.

question: On slippery roads, drivers should:
option1: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.
option2: leave more space in front of their vehicle.

question: If you drive slower than the flow of traffic, you will most likely:
option1: improve traffic flow.
option2: interfere with traffic and receive a ticket.
option3: help create a safe driving environment.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Vehicles may only travel in the center lane.
option2: The center lane is shared for left turns in both directions of travel.
option3: The center lane in both directions of travel will soon turn left.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Watch for vehicles entering from the side
option3: When pavement is wet, reduce your speed

question: This road sign means:
option1: Stop Sign Ahead
option3: Right turn on red light permitted

question: The extra space in front of a large truck is needed for:
option1: other drivers when they want to pass the truck.
option2: the truck driver to stop the vehicle.
option3: other drivers when merging onto a freeway.

question: If your car goes into water, you should:
option1: remove yourself before it starts to sink.
option3: wait for water to rush in and let it out in small breaths through your nose.

question: The ‘One Way’ sign means that:
option1: there is only one road that turns left at the intersection.
option2: drivers may travel only in the direction of the arrow.
option3: only vehicles turning left may travel in the direction of the arrow.

question: Aggressive driving includes:
option1: quick lane changes without a signal.

question: This sign means:
option1: Curve ahead, drive at 40 MPH ot more around the curve ahead
option2: Curve ahead, the recommended speed is 40 MPH or less
option3: If you are driving at 40 MPH or less you must stay in the right-hand lane

question: A flashing red light means:
option1: Drive with caution.
option2: The light will soon change to steady red.
option3: The same as a STOP sign.

question: Are drivers allowed to exceed the speed limit to pass other vehicles?
option1: Yes, but only by 10 MPH or less.
option3: Yes, but only if they drive with caution.

question: At a stop sign there is no stop line or crosswalk. You must stop:
option1: after you enter the intersection, if you have a clear view of traffic on the intersecting roadway.

question: A traffic sign with a red circle around and a slash over a symbol means:
option1: the maneuver shown by the symbol is not allowed.
option2: Do not drive faster than the posted speed limit.
option3: the maneuver shown on the sign should be executed with extreme caution.

question: While you are in the middle of an intersection about to turn left, the light turns red. You should:
option1: stop until you have the green light.
option2: complete the turn when traffic clears.
option3: back out of the intersection, if possible.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Winding road

question: A driver who approaches an intersection:
option1: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.
option2: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.
option3: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.

question: Just like alcohol and other drugs, drowsiness can:
option1: impair your judgment.
option2: help you to be a better driver.

question: A flashing red light:
option1: is used at dangerous intersections.
option2: means the same thing as a stop sign.

question: When they see this sign, drivers should:
option1: slow down and keep well to the right.
option2: increase their speed and keep well to the right.
option3: slow down and keep well to the left.

question: When you see an overhead lane sign with an arrow and the word "ONLY" below it, you should:
option1: change lanes immediately.
option2: go the direction of the arrow.
option3: proceed only if you plan on turning left.

question: Drivers often fail to see a motorcycle headed toward them. Why?
option1: It is difficult to judge a motorcycle's speed.

question: If another vehicle passes you on the left, you must:
option1: decrease your speed slightly and keep to the right.
option2: increase your speed slightly and keep to the right.
option3: decrease your speed, then pull over to the right and stop.

question: This road sign is:
option1: a regulatory sign.

question: To drive defensively, you must:
option1: anticipate errors by other drivers.
option2: not check behind you through your mirrors.
option3: assume that a driver who approaches a STOP sign on a side road is actually going to stop.

question: If a vehicle suddenly cuts in front of you creating a hazard, which of these actions should you take first?
option1: Sound your horn and step on the brake firmly.
option2: Swerve into the lane next to you.
option3: Take your foot off the gas pedal.

question: One broken line indicates:
option1: You can not pass other vehicles or go across the line.
option2: You can change lanes, but only when traffic conditions or obstructions in the road make it necessary.
option3: You can pass other vehicles and change lanes, if it is safe.
